para: SwpaEdges rearranges the interior &sgmts; of neighboring &elems; to improve their shape energy or homogeneity. The possible rearrangements are shown in .

caption.para: The blue and pink pairs of &elems; on the left can replace their shared edge with new edges and become the one of the configurations on the right. When two quadrilaterals are replaced by three, as in the right hand images in the top row, a new &node; is inserted at the average position of its neighbors.

para:
The general procedure for SwapEdges is as follows:
Create a list of &elems; chosen by the targets parameter.
Loop over the target &elems; in random order to avoid any bias due to the order in which they were created.
For the first &elem; in the list, try to swap edges with each of its neighbors in all the possible ways illustrated in .
Replace the &elem; and its neighbor in the &skel; with the swap that best satisfies the criterion, if any. Remove the &elem; and its neighbor from the list. If no swap satisfies the criterion, do nothing.

shows the application of SwapEdges in a &skel;. The &elems; with &sgmts; marked in green in (a) have been replaced in (b). The two pairs of &elem;s on the blue-white boundary have improved their homogeneity, and the pair inside the blue region has improved its shape energy.

(a) Before and (b) after running
